item.title: Two potholes on road outside 13 Parkhouse., 13th February
item.description:
The potholes have been there for a while but the recent prolonged rain has made them worse. Parkhouse St is a one-way rat run so there are lots of vans and lorries and they travel quite quickly. Because the road curves, drivers don’t always see the pothole. If a wheel thuds right through the pothole, the noise and vibration affects the flats directly opposite

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parkhouse Street, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is a pothole here which has reappeared straight after a very bad repair, 13th February
item.description:
This pothole has reappeared after a bad repair by Enfield council contractors a couple of week's ago. All of the tarmac filling in the original hole is coming away due to the extremely poor work. Enfield council were aware of the pothole which cannot be avoided and carried out an ineffectual repair.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haselbury Road, Edmonton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Recurring commercial flytipping issue, 13th February
item.description:
Flytipping of commercial waste has been a recurring issue here for the best part of a year. Neighbours have to move the litter to the appropriate collection point on Mare Street which isn’t their responsibility, especially considering council tax fees…

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haselbury Road, Edmonton, Greater London

item.title: HGV mud on exit to demolition site at 52 Cambridge Road, 13th February
item.description:
Dangerous excess mud on pavement and roadway which could cause slips, outside the demolition site at 52 Cambridge Road. I witnessed this on two consecutive days. The development has a CEMP which requires them to remove excess mud from HGVs. Please could this be removed. Thank you. Cllr Alisa Igoe

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cambridge Road, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
